characters: SIX BULLETS RIP INTO HIS CHEST
AND THE CITY COMES TO LIFE NOW, (VARIOUS ANGLES)
LIGHTING AND CRUSHING OUT CIGARETTES, COFFEE MUGS REFILLE
PILED ON TOP OF ONE ANOTHER LIKE GARBAGE. EACH WITH A SIN
IN HIS HEAD. LOOKING UP AT JIMMY, LAUGHING MANIACALLY.
PAT FALLS ONTO A TABLE, THEN COLLAPSES TO THE FLOOR, DEAD
TIGHT ON THE NEWSPAPER, AN OBITUARY, (WE READ)
THE MUSIC SO-FUCKING LOUD NOW AND COLIN SO-FUCKING STONED

dialogues.speaker: PLAY-BY-PLAY ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: ...Here’s the 2-1 to Dykstra. Low and away, ball 3. Dykstra’s one for two on the night. He singled in the first and grounded into a fielder’s choice... JIMMY CONLON, early 30s, sits behind the wheel, a cigaret dangling from his lips as he listens to the play-by-play. ruddy Irish face is roughened and broken, like that a heavyweight boxer who never knew when to throw in the tow Up ahead, red lights glow as a CADILLAC DEVILLE brakes an steers toward the curb. Jimmy follows, parking at a dista Two men step out of the Deville dressed in suits; SHAWN MAGUIRE, 30s, and his consigliere, PAT MULLEN, 30s. Shawn approaches. Jimmy rolls the window down and Shawn l in. He’s handsome, tough, savagely loyal. The type of lea you'd follow anywhere. And Jimmy does.

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: We're gonna get the parents now. You all set, ace? Jimmy nods. Shawn smiles as sharp as a new penny, playful slaps Jimmy’s cheek, then goes. Jimmy watches as Shawn and Pat approach a duplex and knoc the front door. An ELDERLY COUPLE answers. Shawn shakes t man’s hand and gentlemanly helps the woman down the steps The four enter the Cadillac and it cruises off. Jimmy goes to work now. Shuts off the radio. Stubs out hi cigarette. Slides on leather gloves. Opens the glove compartment and removes a STAINLESS STEEL SW1911 .45 ACP PISTOL. Tucks it into his black leather coat and — EXT. STREET — CONTINUOUS Jimmy strides toward the home we saw the Elderly Couple e Down the alley between homes. Into the BACKYARD now and.. ..-Abruptly, he’s INSIDE THE HOUSE, walking up the STAIRS with the pistol in his hand. He can hear a SHOWER RUNNING starts down the hall in that direction and... ...into a BEDROOM. A fusty, antiquated decor. Paintings o Jesus Christ, the Virgin Mary, a crucifix on the wall. Th Phillies game plays on the television. The sound of the shower gets LOUDER and LOUDER AND LOUDER as he moves into ...the BATHROOM. Thick with steam. Impossible to see. Th water so fucking loud now, like a WATERFALL CRASHING and Jimmy RIPS the shower curtain back. A gaunt, tattooed man BILLY COUGHLIN, 30, startles, covers himself:

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: What the fuck! And now he sees Jimmy and he knows Jimmy and he knows wha he’s come here for and he’s really fucking scared and:

dialogues.speaker: BILLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jimmy, J-Jimmy please, no — Jimmy RAISES the pistol:

dialogues.speaker: BILLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But, Jimmy, I-I’ve been good — I've been so good, Jimmy — I’ve — BLAM! Jimmy FIRES! Right between the eyes. Billy COLLAPSE the floor of the tub like he doesn’t have bones. But strangely he doesn’t die. Instead, he feels at the hole between his eyes and the river of blood racing down his f and he begins to LAUGH. Jimmy raises the pistol again — BLAM! BLAM! — two bullets HOLES in Billy’s chest. He FLOPS AROUND like a fish out o water, GASPING horribly for air...but it’s all a big joke Jimmy FIRES the pistol, over and over, but it only serves make Billy LAUGH LOUDER, MORE MANIACALLY, as if he’s bein tickled by the bullets and — INT. THE ABBEY PUB — FISHTOWN, PHILADELPHIA — (PRESENT DA Jimmy wakes with a start. Breathless and flush. He takes moment to let his nightmare ebb away and then sits up in booth and reaches for a box of Marlboros. Lights one and sucks in a long, soothing drag. There, that’s better. He’s in his late forties now and the years since he worke hitman for Shawn Maguire haven’t been kind to him. Scragg four-day beard. Eyes stung with exhaustion and glassy fro too-much booze. The place is decorated for the holidays and Burl Ives sin ‘Holly Jolly Christmas’ on the jukebox. Rough and profane IRISHMEN of all ages play pool, shoot the breeze at the b toss darts. This is home base for Shawn’s crew. MAN’S VOICE (0.C.) Hey Conlon. Jimmy looks over at FRANK DORSEY, 30s, a bulky, arrogant bruiser sitting on a stool among a group of ROUGHNECKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were fartin’ in your sleep again, yunno?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: How the fuck would I know that? I was sleepin’.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You oughta try them geriatric diapers. In case ya shit yourself. Roughnecks SNICKER.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: (mutters under his breath) Go fuck your mothers. Jimmy grabs a bottle of Bud. Two gulps in he realizes it’ full of cigarette butts. He SPITS the beer out in a huge spray, all over his sweatshirt.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fuckin’ — motherfuckin’ shit... Frank and Roughnecks LAUGH. The rear door opens. Jimmy watches as COLIN MAGUIRE, 27, brash and irresponsible, enters with two plainclothes detectives; JASON SAYERS, 40s, white, boyishly handsome, TERRY NANCE, 40s, black, wiry. The three duck into a back office. REAR HALLWAY — MINUTES LATER Jimmy waits outside the BACK OFFICE. Inside, Colin finish telling Sayers and Nance a joke:

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: — But how’s that gonna make my tits any bigger? Boyfriend says, Beats me, but it worked on your ass. Sayers and Nance LAUGH. Colin reaches into a drawer and h both cops envelopes thick with cash.

dialogues.speaker: SAYERS NANCE
dialogues.text: Thanks, Colin. ‘Preciate that, Colin.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (glances at his watch) Alright get outta here. Shit, shower, shave time for me. Sayers and Nance stand.

dialogues.speaker: SAYERS
dialogues.text: Got a hot date? Gonna sniff a little pussy under the mistletoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish. I’m introducin’ my father to a new client tonight. Been tryin’ to put this fuckin’ deal together for nine months. Finally the old man agrees to hear me out.

dialogues.speaker: SAYERS
dialogues.text: Well he’s a busy man your father.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: (with disdain) Yeah no shit. Merry Christmas, fellas. Sayers and Nance exit the office, tossing a glare in Jimm direction on their way out the back door. Colin still hasn't noticed Jimmy. He sits behind the desk dumps a baggy of cocaine onto a mirror. Razorblades a lin and SNORTS a bump. He looks restless and edgy. Jimmy KNOCKS. Startled, Colin looks up:

dialogues.speaker: COLIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ! Can I get one fuckin’ moment to myself? Whaddayou want?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: (stepping inside) I talked to your dad this mornin’. The furnace blew over at my place. Told me to see you about a loan.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: A loan or a handout? Colin shakes his head in disgust, pulls out a roll of cas

dialogues.speaker: COLIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're like a fuckin’ annuity, you know that? Why my old man keeps you around, I got no idea.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Maybe it’s got summin’ to do with us bein’ friends goin’ on fifty years. That type’a shit matters to some people, yunno?

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Anyone can put up with you that long oughta be canonized. (re: cash) How much?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Uh, ‘bout eight hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don’t know what the fuck ‘about eight hundred’ means. Gimme a number.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Eight hundred. Colin offers Jimmy the cash. When Jimmy reaches for it, C pulls it back... reconsidering... a smirk curling...

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Actually I’m gonna make you earn this. He points to a SANTA CLAUS COSTUME hanging on a closet do

dialogues.speaker: COLIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: McCauley’s fat ass cancelled on me.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: No. Fuck that. I gotta get home.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: (pulls the cash away) Fair enough. Get home and freeze your dick off. Off Jimmy, looking at the suit, then the cash... INT. PHILADELPHIA INT’L AIRPORT — BAGGAGE CLAIM — AFTERNO Large wrapped gifts circle the carousel. Arriving COLLEGE STUDENTS are welcomed home by their PARENTS. A GIRL excit jumps into the arms of her BOYFRIEND. And watching it all is MIKE CONLON, late 20s, good-lookin athletic. He’s dressed in his chauffeur uniform and stand among the other DRIVERS holding placards. It’s like any o day... except today Mike’s placard reads: VICK, M. TONY, 60s, a gruff colleague, stands beside him.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You gonna ask him about those three interceptions last weekend?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Yeah, Tone, cause that’s exactly what he wants to talk about... (a moment, then: ) I stopped at Target on my way over and bought two footballs. I’m gonna see if he’1l sign ‘em for my daughters.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Bad idea, kiddo. Repko got canned for doin’ that, yunno? Asked Bette Midler for a picture. She went batshit and filed a report to Farina. Now he’s pushin’ hot dogs outside the ballpark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (torn) Anybody else I wouldn't bother, it’s just... they’re his biggest fans. You should see ‘em on Sundays. Wake up wearin’ his jersey and sit two inches from the TV screen. And here comes MICHAEL VICK off the escalator. Fine suit under a long black overcoat. People take notice, point, stare, snap Iphone pictures. He strides towards Mike.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good evening, Mr. Vick. I can take that for you. Mike grabs Vick’s luggage and follows him toward the exit glances back at Tony, who mouths: Don’t Do It. INT. MIKE’S LIMOUSINE, MOVING — EARLY EVENING SPORTS TALK on the RADIO. Mike drives, stealing glances a Vick in the rearview who is busy texting on his Blackberr Mike’s eyes shift to the passenger seat where’s he placed two just-purchased footballs alongside a Sharpie pen. A CALLER on the RADIO becomes prominent:

dialogues.speaker: CALLER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This is Andy from Roxborough. Michael Vick is a bum! He’s a bum and — Mike REACTS quickly and shuts the radio off. He glances embarrassedly back at Vick who is looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Sorry about that... Lotta haters in this town. EXT. LUXURY HIGH-RISE — RITTENHOUSE — NIGHT The limo arrives out front. Mike opens the door for Vick then removes his luggage. Vick hands him a generous tip.

dialogues.speaker: VICK
dialogues.text: Appreciate the ride, man.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Sure thing. Good luck this weekend. Vick wheels the luggage toward the lobby entrance. Mike l at the footballs in the car... then at Vick walking away. EXT. MAGUIRE HOME — FISHTOWN — ESTABLISHING — NIGHT Like every other row home on the street. A bit nicer, but much. Through the windows, we see a HOLIDAY PARTY underwa  MAN’S VOICE (V.O.) I’m told you’re the Prince of the City, Mr. Maguire. That you have friends in all the places one could hope to have friends. INT. MAGUIRE HOME — OFFICE — NIGHT CLOSE ON: SHAWN MAGUIRE sitting behind a large mahogany d He’s 50 years old now and he’s aged as well as any man co hope to. We hear the sounds of the party outside the door

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: You shouldn't believe everything you hear. I’m a simple man. I grew up in this house. My father sat behind this desk. The guests just outside that door I’ve known since I was a boy. Across from Shawn sits STEVAN KUJOVIC, 30s, an impeccably dressed Serbian. His bodyguard GORAN, 40, hangs by the do Never far from Shawn’s side, PAT MULLEN stands nearby.

dialogues.speaker: KUJOVIC
dialogues.text: Either way, I'd like to make an arrangement with you.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: What’s in it for us?

dialogues.speaker: KUJOVIC
dialogues.text: Money, of course. A million up-front. He sets a leather briefcase on the desk and opens it. Sha glances at the STACKS OF CASH inside. KUJOVIC (CONT’D) After that you’1ll receive twenty percent of all the product you allow to pass safely through the port. Kujovic reaches into his jacket and removes a small baggy cocaine. KUJOVIC (CONT’D) (re: the cocaine) My associates have a name for it. Virgin. 99 percent pure. The very best in the world. Shawn mulls the cash a moment, seemingly impressed. Then:

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: The business has changed, Mr. Kujovic. The mob’s dead. Last week the Feds arrested two members of what’s left of the Gambino Family. They were driving sixteen year old girls to New Jersey to have sex in short-stays while they collected half the hourly fuck rate... (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty years ago I made a living the same way we all did. A few big scores a year, but mostly I was a grinder. You wanted to lay down on a few ball games, you came to me. You wanted to open a butcher shop and the bank said fuck-you on the loan, you came to me. Know what that butcher shop is today? (pause for effect) An Applebee's.

dialogues.speaker: KUJOVIC
dialogues.text: Why are you telling me this?

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: Because there’s no money in that business anymore. I’ve had to adapt. Find other ways to make a living. But I don’t deal in drugs. Know why?

dialogues.speaker: KUJOVIC
dialogues.text: Enlighten me.

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: It’s a whore’s business. And the pimps like you that bring that poison to the streets are worse than those two guineas peddling underage pussy at the Econo Lodge... D’you understand me? The two men stare at each other an anxious moment, then:

dialogues.speaker: KUJOVIC
dialogues.text: I think this meeting is over.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Good observation. Silently livid, Kujovic closes the briefcase and stands. and Goran move to exit. Before they can:

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: One more thing... (Kujovic turns back) Whoever told you I had friends in this city was right. Make sure I never hear your name again. Kujovic dismisses the threat with a smirk, then goes. INT. FAMILY ROOM — NIGHT The Annual Maguire Family Holiday Party. The space is cro with FAMILY, FRIENDS, SENIOR MEMBERS OF THE GANG and thei YOUNG CHILDREN. GIFTS are scattered around a CHRISTMAS TR We find COLIN standing by a makeshift bar. Beside him, is KENAN BOYLE, 28, a born-bad roughneck friend tattooed toe neck. Colin tosses back a shot of vodka. Probably his ten

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bartender) Gimme anotha one, will ya.

dialogues.speaker: KENAN
dialogues.text: (nudges Colin) Here he comes now. He’s referring to Kujovic who is making his way towards t

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: (to Bartender) Make it three, huh. (sees him lift a bottle) Not that, fuckhead, the good shit. Kujovic arrives. Colin excitedly offers him a shot of vod

dialogues.speaker: COLIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: To a very Merry fuckin’ Christmas and many more to come. But Kujovic doesn’t accept the shot. He just stares at Co

dialogues.speaker: KUJOVIC
dialogues.text: You have until tomorrow night to return my down payment, Colin.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: (nonplussed) ...What are you talkin’ about?

dialogues.speaker: KUJOVIC
dialogues.text: I paid you to guarantee your father’s support —

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah and —

dialogues.speaker: KUJOVIC
dialogues.text: And he just told me he’d rather deal with a guinea pimp than me... Tomorrow night. Or you know how this ends. Colin sees it burning in Kujovic’s eyes: the threat very real. Kujovic and Goran leave. Off Colin, confused, angry... INT. STUDY — NIGHT Colin storms in and marches up to his father’s desk.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Kujovic just walked out. What’d you say to him?

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: I heard him out like you asked me to, and then I wished him safe travels.  10.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Did you even fuckin’ listen to what he had to say?

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Colin, that’s not our business —

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: (WHIPS to Pat, sharply) You shut your mouth! I’m talkin’ to my father. Pat nods, backs off.

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: What’s the problem, Colin?

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: The problem is all I ever hear outta your mouth is when am I gonna pull my weight. So now I bring in a piece of business — a good piece of business —

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: And you're mad I just let it walk out the door?

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: If I listened to every good piece of business you brought in, I’d be livin’ in the basement of Saint Anne’s Church, stealing crumbs from the mice. Pat stifles a laugh. Colin feels small. SHAWN (CONT’D) (dismissive, patronizing) Now go have another drink. Abruptly, Colin grabs Shawn’s highball of scotch and FIRE against the wall behind his father’s head. It SHATTERS! Shawn doesn’t so much as flinch. Colin stares at his father a long moment. So much rage in those eyes. Been building for years.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: When are you gonna take me seriously? And with that Shawn realizes just how deep this goes. Col KICKS over a chair and storms off. As he passes Pat:

dialogues.speaker: COLIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And fuck you, too!  11. INT. UPSTAIRS BEDROOM — NIGHT It’s Santa Claus...or rather Jimmy dressed in the Santa C suit, sitting alone in a barrel back chair. Asleep, SNORI glass of whiskey in his lap. A KNOCK at the door. BRENDAN, 40, a broad-shouldered memb of the gang, peeks in.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Jimmy. (LOUDER now) Jimmy Jimmy shoots up:

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: What? Who’s there?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Come on. Get up, old man. The kids’re waitin’ for ya downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Okay. Right... Jimmy labors to his feet and pours himself another glass whiskey. He pulls down his long white beard and erases it a single gulp.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let’s get this shit over with. He leaves the room. INT. MIKE’S ROW HOME — PORT RICHMOND — FRONT DOOR — NIGHT Modest but cozy. A Christmas tree festooned with homespun ornaments. Monogrammed stockings hang from the mantel. Mike enters, stomps the snow off his shoes. Removes his k cap and gloves. His daughters, CATELYN, 6, and, LILY, 4, up to him, full of excitement.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: There they are...

dialogues.speaker: CATELYN
dialogues.text: Did you get it, Dad?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Did you get it, Dad?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Get what? Catelyn glowers, hands on hips: you know what. Mike SIGHS  12.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, guys. I chickened out. I had it all planned — I knew exactly how I was gonna ask him and then... But as Mike takes off his coat, we see the footballs stuf up the back of his shirt. The girls beam and quickly wres them out. They’ve both been signed — to Catelyn and to Li — from Michael Vick. Elated, the girls race off:

dialogues.speaker: CATELYN, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Mommy, look what Dad got me!

dialogues.speaker: LILY, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Look what Dad got me, mom. Mike smiles, follows them into the —

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: where his wife SARAH, late 20s, an understated beauty, ei months pregnant now, sets dinner out on the kitchen table still dressed in her waitress uniform from an earlier shi

dialogues.speaker: CATELYN
dialogues.text: Wow. Are those special or what? Now let’s sit down for dinner, ok? The girls sit at the table. Mike wraps his arms around Sa

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: How was your day?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: The washing machine broke again. Tim Borzell came over to look at it.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: And I saw one on sale at Sears for $600 dollars.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (forces a smile) I'll ask Vince if I can pick up some extra shifts, alright? They kiss, then join the girls at the table. Dinner — chi casserole, string beans, crescent rolls — is passed aroun

dialogues.speaker: CATELYN
dialogues.text: Guess what happened in school today?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Guess what happened in school today?

dialogues.speaker: CATELYN
dialogues.text: Dad, tell Lily to stop copying me.  13.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Lily, stop copying your sister.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Lily, stop copying your sister. Mike looks at her. She smiles mischievously, adorably.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Oh now you’re gonna copy me?

dialogues.speaker: LILY MIKE
dialogues.text: Oh now you’re gonna copy me? You know what that means —

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tickle Monster! He begins to TICKLE her. She laughs like crazy. Sarah smi INT. MAGUIRE HOME — FAMILY ROOM — NIGHT All the guests are congregated around the fireplace inclu SHAWN, his beautiful wife, ROSE, 50s, and PAT. Jimmy, fal down drunk by now, sits in a leather chair as YOUNG CHILD take turns sitting on his lap, disclosing their wish list

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Alright, who’s up next? An attractive YOUNG MOTHER sets her DAUGHTER on Jimmy's l

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s your name, sweetie?

dialogues.speaker: DAUGHTER
dialogues.text: Kirsten.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: D’you think Mommy wants to sit on Santa’s other knee, Kirsten? Muffled LAUGHS from the Guests. FRANK isn’t amused.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: That's my wife, Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: (SCANS the crowd) Who's that? Frank? (to Young Mother) Gimme a call if you wanna add a few inches. I’m skinny but I’m long. Frank starts like he’s about to have a go at Jimmy. A MAL GUEST holds him back. Rose whispers to Shawn:  14.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Whose idea was it to have Jimmy do this? Shawn keeps quiet, but his eyes move to COLIN in the hall he’s cornered a YOUNG WOMAN... she looks uncomfortable, scared even... he tries to kiss her... she slips away... Colin finishes his drink, mouths fuckin’ bitch... Their e meet for a moment... father and son... Shawn turns away.. Jimmy takes another slug of whiskey.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Okay, Kirsten, let’s see what Santa brought for you this year. Jimmy stands and moves to the Christmas tree. He bends do to pick up a gift, teeters, then pitches forward, catchin himself on the blazing hot fire screen. It BURNS his hand

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: OWW! SHIT! GODDAMN FUCKIN’ — ! He FALLS to his knees, clutching his hand, muttering curs The children are scared, unsure what to do. Shawn glances at Pat, and motions for him to get in there Pat moves to Jimmy. Brendan assists now as well and the t manage to get him to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Come on, Jimmy, let’s take a break.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I’m fine, I'm fine —

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: You're not fine. You’re drunk is whatcha are. (to the kids) Santa’ll be right back, guys.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BOY
dialogues.text: What happened to him?

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: One’a the reindeer got hurt. INT. UPSTAIRS BATHROOM — NIGHT ON SHAWN: watching from the doorway as Pat and Brendan ta the Santa suit off Jimmy, so drunk he can’t stand up on h own. There’s a small sadness in Shawn’s eyes... it pains to see his oldest friend this way... The suit is off and Pat hands it over to SKINNY YOUNG HOO who quickly puts it on. It’s far too big.  15.

dialogues.speaker: SKINNY HOOD
dialogues.text: This thing don’t fit me so good, Mr. Maguire.

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: Just get your ass downstairs. Skinny Hood nods, goes. Pat and Brendan shove Jimmy into shower now. He resists, drunk and mumbling...

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Getchyour fuckin’ hands off’a — ..-but it’s futile. They shove him into the bath and turn the shower. The cold water takes his breath. He GASPS. Off Jimmy, tired of fighting back... so tired of it all.. sinking to the floor of the tub... INT. MIKE’S ROW HOME — GIRLS’ BEDROOM — NIGHT ON CATELYN and LILY, asleep in their bunk beds, signed footballs under their arms. Mike shuts off the light and closes the door. INT. MASTER BEDROOM — NIGHT Mike climbs into bed beside Sarah who is busy cutting and arranging old photos into a collage.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What’re you workin’ on?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: It’s for the baby. Show him what our lives were like before he came along. Mike looks at the collage entitled ‘US BEFORE YOU’. HIS POV: A picture of him and Sarah at a high school prom Another of him, Catelyn and Lily dressed up for Halloween And mixed in is a photo of MIKE AS A YOUNG BOY. His First Holy Communion. Standing beside him is his father, JIMMY. Sarah follows his gaze to the photo. SARAH (CONT’D) I can take it out.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: No. We'll just go like this. He fits in another picture so it covers Jimmy completely.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There. Now I won’t have to see him for another five years.  16. INT. MAGUIRE HOME — ATTIC BEDROOM — NIGHT Jimmy lies on one of the two single beds, staring up at t low, vaulted ceiling. His hand is bandaged and his hair i still wet from the shower and he’s wearing one of Shawn's robes. JIMMY’S POV: a CRACK in the plaster. He reaches up touch it now, running his fingers along the grooves.

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: You remember what that’s from, dontcha? Jimmy looks up. Shawn enters and approaches. SHAWN (CONT’D) Had to be what, ‘71? I’m in this bed with Jenny Blake. You’re over there with — what was that redhead’s name?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Maureen Galvin.

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: And all of a sudden I hear my dad’s voice boom from downstairs. Who the fuck’s been drinkin’ my scotch!? Well she jumped off’a me so fast. Smacked her head right there and knocked herself out. Jimmy CHUCKLES, remembering that time. He lights a cigare now as Shawn sits on the twin bed across from him.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Rosie mad at me?

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: Ah she'll get over it... (ve: the cigarettes) Gimme one’a those, will ya? She’1l think the smoke’s comin’ from you. Jimmy hands Shawn a cigarette, lights it for him. They si there smoking for a few moments. SHAWN (CONT’D) Wanna tell me what’s going on? (off look) Come on, Jimmy, you look like a fuckin’ castaway. You told Frank you wanted to dick his wife, and you're not gonna be able to jerk-off for the next two months. A beat. Jimmy conceding now —

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: You ‘member Billy Coughlin?  17.

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I can’t sleep no more. Keep seein’ his face in my dreams... he’s in the shower... got a hole in his head an’ he can’t stop laughin’ at me. Before Coughlin it was Terry Burke and before him it was Vince Amato and —

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: Billy Coughlin was a pederast, Jimmy. He would wait outside the ball fields askin’ little boys if they wanted to see his parents’ basement... Remember what he did to George Martin’s boy? (Jimmy NODS) He’s never been right since. How many more would he have gotten to if we hadn’t done somethin’?... He got what he deserved... They all did. Jimmy nods perfunctorily. He believed that once, but late it’s been weighing on him... the demons... SHAWN (CONT’D) Look at me... Jimmy does. Shawn leans forward and puts his hand behind friend's neck the way fathers often do to sons. SHAWN (CONT’D) What do I always tell you? Whereever we're going when we cross that line, we're going together... Me and you... Off Jimmy, looking into Shawn’s eyes... believing him... always believing him... FADE OUT. EXT. PHILADELPHIA/SCHUYLKILL RIVER — WIDE — FOLLOWING NIG The skyline is seen beyond the Garden Street Bridge. A million lights shimmer on the Schuylkill River.

dialogues.speaker: AND THE CITY COMES TO LIFE NOW, (VARIOUS ANGLES)
dialogues.text: ...A SUBWAY arrives at 30TH STREET STATION. WORKER BEES s out and hotfoot it to the escalator... UPENN COEDS scuttl off to the bars... PROSTITUTES prowl the streets of JUNIA all fishnet and faux mink, shouting promises of cheap pus and ass... FANS funnel into the WELLS FARGO ARENA for a 7 game... PATROL CRUISERS race down CECIL B. MOORE AVENUE, SIRENS BLARING... ‘PLAYERS’ deal junk in Fairhill... INT. MIKE’S LIMOUSINE, MOVING — NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike drives. A 76ers game broadcast on the radio:

dialogues.speaker: PLAY-BY-PLAY ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: The tip’s controlled by Brand and we're underway... Igoudala over the line... cross-court to Holiday now... Mike GLANCES UP at the rearview mirror. KUJOVIC and GORAN sitting in the backseat.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Which airline, fellas?

dialogues.speaker: KUJOVIC
dialogues.text: United. But we have a stop to make first. INT. MAYFAIR DINER — NIGHT A greasy spoon for down-and-outers. Jimmy sits in a booth smoking, reviewing the football odds in the sports sectio His right hand heavily bandaged from the burn last night. MAN’S VOICE (0.C.) Look what the cat dragged in. Jimmy looks up at DETECTIVE JOHN HARDING, 50. Hard-nosed, seen-it-all, inured to the lonely, god-awful-shitty life homicide detective; and his partner, DETECTIVE JOSE FLORE 35, fresh-faced, just promoted. Harding motions to sit do

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I’m expecting someone.

dialogues.speaker: HARDING
dialogues.text: Bullshit. You don’t have any friends, Conlon. Harding and Flores sit across from Jimmy. HARDING (CONT’D) Detective Flores, meet Jimmy Conlon. Jimmy and I used to spend a lotta time together back when he was killing people for Shawn Maguire. Harding says it loud enough for people to hear. PATRONS t and stare a moment.

dialogues.speaker: FLORES
dialogues.text: (offering his hand) Nice to meetcha, Jimmy. Jimmy ignores him.

dialogues.speaker: HARDING
dialogues.text: We used to have a name for him at Homicide. Jimmy The Gravedigger.  19.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: What happened to the other guy? That ginzo you used to follow around?

dialogues.speaker: HARDING
dialogues.text: Tornetta?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Yeah, the ginzo.

dialogues.speaker: HARDING
dialogues.text: Retired. Lives down in Atlantic City now. Spends his weekends blowin’ his pension at the craps tables. Got tired of working with a DA on Maguire's payroll. Tired of seeing murderers like you walk free.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Maybe you shoulda taken a bite outta that pie, Harding. You wouldn’t still be wearing suits like that.

dialogues.speaker: HARDING
dialogues.text: You don’t like the suit?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: When’s the last time you got pussy?

dialogues.speaker: HARDING
dialogues.text: Last night actually.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: (re: Flores) I mean other than the one between his legs. Jimmy and Harding stare at each other a long moment. Lots history here. All of it unresolved.

dialogues.speaker: HARDING
dialogues.text: What’s the number, Jimmy? Tornetta had you at sixteen, but I always thought it was more. I made a list once. All the names. Every life you ruined.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: How’d that work out?

dialogues.speaker: HARDING
dialogues.text: Nineteen. That’s your number, right? (Jimmy doesn’t flinch. To Flores now) You ‘member the Good Friday murders?

dialogues.speaker: FLORES
dialogues.text: Yeah. Jogger found three bodies in the woods along Pennypack Creek.  20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAN’S FACE AS HARDING SAYS THEIR NAMES:

dialogues.speaker: HARDING, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Ernest Hayes... Ted Grady... and Glenn Cavetto.

dialogues.speaker: HARDING
dialogues.text: Each had a .45 slug in his frontal lobe. Those had to be yours, Jimmy. It’s got your signature all over it. Single bullet. Nice and clean. Always to the forehead so you could look ‘em in the eyes before blowing ‘em to kingdom come, right?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Names don’t ring a bell.

dialogues.speaker: HARDING
dialogues.text: They should. You were the godfather to Cavetto’s son. (beat) Come on, just whisper it in my ear. Hand to God it never leaves this table... What’s the number? Jimmy appears to be coming to a decision. It seems as if ready to relieve himself of some long-held burden. He exh a large stream of smoke then leans forward. Harding, too.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: (whispers) Your partner’s got his foot in my crotch and he’s ticklin’ my balls. Harding looks at Jimmy: some assholes never change.

dialogues.speaker: HARDING
dialogues.text: (to Flores) Let’s go. I lost my appetite all of a sudden. Harding and Flores slide out of the booth. Before Harding leaves, he sets his card in front of Jimmy. HARDING (CONT’D) When the nightmares get so bad you can’t stand to look at yourself no more, gimme a call. Harding and Flores go. Off Jimmy, wondering if he’s already reached that point..  21. INT. COLIN’S ROW HOME — MAYFAIR — NIGHT Pearl Jam ‘Rearviewmirror’ — BLARES from a stereo. Colin Kenan are snorting lines of blow on the couch. They've be at it a while. Amped-up and high as kites. The DOORBELL RINGS. Colin does a final line, then tucks t mirror into a drawer. Kenan stands and answers the door o Kujovic and Goran who step inside.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Hey, there the boys! Goran pats Kenan down, then does the same to Colin.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whoa whoa, easy. You're grabbin’ at the real weapon there, pal. That’s the pussyslayer ya got a grip on, chief! (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: GORDAN
dialogues.text: (to Kujovic, in Serbian) (Clean. )

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Siddown, siddown. Kujovic sits. Goran stands by the door.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How ‘bout a drink, huh? Vodka? Scotch? Whatever ya need.

dialogues.speaker: KUJOVIC
dialogues.text: We have a plane to catch. Where’s my money?

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: (chuckles) You're a businessman. I like that. (to Kenan) You heard the man. He wants his money. Kenan nods, leaves the room. INT. LIMO/EXT. STREET OUTSIDE COLIN’S HOUSE — NIGHT Mike’s reading the Daily News when he notices a skinny bl youth in a 76ers Iverson jersey, CURTIS BANKS, 12, ride b a bike. The boy circles back, keen to get a look at the c Mike smiles, returns his attention back to the news. Then — a TAP at the window. It’s CURTIS, backpack over hi shoulders. Mike rolls the window down.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Can I help you?  22.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: This your limo?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: That’s right.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: Can I get a ride in it?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Sorry, buddy, I’m uh... I’m with a customer right now. But Curtis doesn’t leave. He looks around at the interior

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You out here by yourself? (Curtis NODS) Pretty late to be ridin’ around on your own, dontcha think?

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: I aint scared.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Your parents know where you are?

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: My mom works nights as a nurse. My brother, he’s a’posed to be watchin’ me, but he’s off with his friends... You can’t even take me around the block?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Wish I could, pal —

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: Can I at least get in then? Never been inside a limo before. A beat. Mike, taking pity on the kid:

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Where do you live? Curtis points to an APARTMENT TOWER in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tell ya what. I’1l letcha take a look around if you head home after. Deal? Curtis BEAMS, sets his bike on the sidewalk and climbs in car. Mike watches him in the rearview as he looks around. Awed. Touching everything. It’s as if he’s in a spaceship from some other planet.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: This ride is gangsta, yo! Kanye style!  23.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What’s your name?

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: Curtis... but erry’one calls me Legs.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Legs?

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: Mmm hmm.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I'm Mike... Whadda they call ya Legs for? Curtis switches the radio dial, finds a HIP-HOP station.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: Check me out, Mike! He stands and DANCES. Legs of rubber. Damn good, too. Mike watches, smiles, switches on the ‘star’ ceiling ligh INT. COLIN’S HOUSE — NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: THE MUSIC SO-FUCKING LOUD NOW AND COLIN SO-FUCKING STONED
dialogues.text: he SINGS along, bobbing his head. He’s sitting on the cou Kujovic directly across from him in an armchair. Kenan reenters the room and hands Kujovic a duffle bag. Kujovic unzips it and looks inside:

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: It’s all there. Count it if you want. REVEAL that the bag is filled with a pile of MONOPOLY MON Kujovic looks up at Colin. Colin starts to LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: KUJOVIC
dialogues.text: This is funny to you?

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: (tries to stop laughing but can’t) I’m sorry, I’m sorry, it’s just... Think what you could buy with all that money! You could put up a fuckin’ luxury high-rise on Park Place! (more LAUGHS)

dialogues.speaker: KUJOVIC
dialogues.text: Do you have any idea what my associates are going to do to you?

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: No. But I got a pretty good fuckin’ idea what I’m gonna do to you. What _ happens next, happens in an instant:  24. COLIN reaches under the coffee table where a 9MM PISTOL h been affixed with tape. He RIPS IT OFF — AIMS THE PISTOL KUJOVIC and — BLAM! — a bullet to his forehead and — GORAN goes wide-eyed, REACHES inside his coat but — COLIN’S FASTER — BLAM! BLAM! — TWO SHOTS TEAR INTO HIS CH He COLLAPSES to his knees, pitches forward, and dies. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Kenan re: the music) Turn that shit off. Kenan, addled by the sudden violence, switches the stereo off. Stone quiet now. He looks at the bodies and the so-m blood leaking from Goran and spreading across the floor.

dialogues.speaker: KENAN
dialogues.text: Whadda we do now?

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Get ‘em to the basement. Colin and Kenan move to Goran first. Lift his arms. As th do, Colin glances outside and notices the limo: Fuck... INT. LIMO — CONTINUOUS Curtis is jamming out to the music in the back. Mike watc the house, sees the front door open and Colin step out.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Curtis. (no answer, louder now) Legs.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: (looks up) Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Get down for a second, huh. Curtis CROUCHES low on the floor. Trying to maintain a level of professionalism, Mike puts driver's cap back on, switches the music to easy listenin and raises the tinted backseat window. As Colin makes his way towards the limo, Mike’s face crea with recognition: Is that...? Before he can process it — TAP-TAP-TAP — Colin raps his knuckles on the window. Moti for Mike to roll it down. Mike lowers the window. IN A FLASH, Colin presses the 9mm against his temple. He reaches inside the car with his le hand now, turns the engine off and takes the keys.  25.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Get outta the car.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What’s the uh...what’s the problem?

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: The problem is you’re still in the fuckin’ car. Now get out. CLOSE ON CURTIS: he looks up, just enough to see the pist against Mike’s head. He freezes, afraid to breathe. Mike nods, opens the car door and steps outside. EXT. COLIN’S HOUSE — CONTINUOUS Colin has the 9MM against Mike’s back. They arrive at the front door. Through the edge of the window shade, Mike glimpses the living room: SEES Kujovic slumped in the armchair, blood dripping from his head onto the floor.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Open the door. Mike freezes, hand on the door knob, mind racing. He know what awaits him on the other side of that door.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (losing patience, PRODS Mike) I said open the fuckin’ door. Mike TURNS THE KNOB and is about to step inside when — BOOM — a CAR DOOR OPENS in the street behind them — Colin TURNS BACK — SEES CURTIS FLEE THE LIMO — HOP ON his BIKE AND PEDAL OFF — Mike sees his opportunity — ENTERS the home, then SLAMS T DOOR SHUT on COLIN’S ARM as he tries to get in —

dialogues.speaker: AHHH
dialogues.text: Colin DROPS his pistol and — Mike RACES for the back door — past GORAN’S BODY — throug the FAMILY ROOM — into the KITCHEN — almost there when — THWOOMP! — he’s DRILLED BY KENAN, who arrives from out of nowhere with a lowered shoulder and — Mike GOES AIRBORNE — FLIES into the kitchen table and CRA to the floor — BLEEDING from a gash above his eye. Kenan stands over him.  26.

dialogues.speaker: KENAN
dialogues.text: The fuck do you think you’re goin’? Kenan DRAWS his pistol and trains it on Mike — waiting fo instructions from Colin who is slowly making his way in f the family room, cursing under his breath, clutching his Mike NOTICES a partially cracked glass on the floor — thi fast — GRABS it and STABS the jagged edge into Kenan’s le

dialogues.speaker: AHH
dialogues.text: Mike’s on his feet — Colin RUNS in from the family room — raises his pistol an FIRES — BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! — each shot narrowly missing — MIKE who is OUT THE BACK DOOR — TEARING across the snowy BACKYARD — VAULTS A CHAIN-LINK FENCE — into another backy where a VICIOUS DOBERMAN boasts its fangs and CHASES —

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Oh fuck — oh fuck — oh fuck — Mike HOPS a second fence — SHAKES OFF the growling Doberm which has a mouthful of his pant leg and — Colin and Kenan — not far behind, CHASING Mike and — Mike emerges from the backyard into a STREET — looks arou — can HEAR the FOOTFALLS and VOICES of Colin and Kenan approaching. He LEAVES FRAME... A beat. ..-COLIN and KENAN emerge into the street. Look up and do Nothing. They spread out now. Peering in car windows. Und others. Everywhere. No sign of Mike. Finally, conceding:

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Come on, let’s go. As Colin and Kenan leave, WE REVEAL MIKE, hiding under a just feet away from where Kenan was checking... He hears walk off... exhales.. EXT. COLIN’S HOUSE — MINUTES LATER Colin opens the limo door, looks around. WALLET and CELL PHONE in the console. Colin opens the wallet, slips out t Driver’s license: MICHAEL THOMAS CONLON.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ... EXT. LEONARD STREET, MAYFAIR — NIGHT — ESTABLISHING Pallid row homes as far as the eye can see.  27. INT. JIMMY’S ROW HOME — NIGHT Beside a dying fire, Jimmy reclines on a tattered Lazy Bo It’s freezing in here and he’s wearing a knit cap and he’ covered himself with dozens of afghans and shower towels. nearly empty pint bottle of Jim Bean sits on the end tabl A KNOCK at the door. Jimmy takes off the pile of warmth a moves that way, opening the door on a HVAC REPAIRMAN, 30.

dialogues.speaker: HVAC MAN
dialogues.text: You Jimmy?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Yeah. You the guy was a’posed to be here two hours ago?

dialogues.speaker: HVAC MAN
dialogues.text: (stepping inside with his equipment ) Sorry ‘bout that, pal. Woman on Frankford had raccoons in her attic ducts. Nasty fuckin’ critters.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Furnace is in the basement. Door’s right there.

dialogues.speaker: HVAC MAN
dialogues.text: Y’got anything to eat, buddy? Bagel chips or pretzels or somethin’ salty like that? I’m starvin’. Jimmy looks askance at him.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Do you want me to put my foot up your ass?

dialogues.speaker: HVAC MAN
dialogues.text: Right. HVAC Man heads down into the basement. The PHONE RINGS. Jimmy crosses into the kitchen, answers.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Hello?... Yeah, Shawn... Michael?... My Michael? INT. BEDROOM CLOSET — NIGHT Jimmy pushes aside clutter until he finds an old shoe shi kit case. Opens it revealing the SW1911 PISTOL (the very gun we saw in the opening scene). It’s old, been out of service for a while. He lifts the pistol out of the case, tucks a few extra cl into his pockets.  28. EXT. JIMMY’S ROW HOME — NIGHT As Jimmy exits in a bulky brown parka and moves to a ‘94 BUICK CENTURY in the street. Climbs in and starts the car INT. MIKE’S ROW HOME — NIGHT As Mike bursts in. Sweating, flushed, a trickle of blood running down the side of his face from the cut above his He can HEAR the GIRLS and SARAH in the kitchen. TALKING, GIGGLING. Takes a moment to compose himself. Doesn’t want alarm them. Checks his look in the mirror. Clears away th blood. Finally crosses into the —

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: where Sarah, Catelyn and Lily are at the table decorating Christmas cookies. Sarah looks up.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You’re back early.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Girls, go get your things packed up. You’re gonna sleep over your Uncle Drew’s house tonight.

dialogues.speaker: CATELYN
dialogues.text: (excited) Really?!

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Really!?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Hurry up and get ready. The girls RACE OFF excitedly. Sarah looks askance at Mike

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What’s going on? And now she sees the cut over his eye. A rivulet of blood runs down the side of his face. She stands and moves to h SARAH (CONT’D) Oh my God, Mike. Are you alright? Sarah reaches for a napkin and dabs at the cut.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: The clients I picked up. I drove them to a house... Colin Maguire’s house...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Colin Maguire? You mean —  29.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes. And he...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: ..-He what, Mike?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: ...They’re both dead. Murdered.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (beat, nonplussed) Oh my God. Oh my God — did you call the police? (Mike shakes his head) Mike.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Sarah, it’s not that simple with these people —

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What do you mean it’s not that simple?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I grew up around this stuff. Okay? I know what they’re capable of. I just... I have to think about this.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What’s there to think about?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH MIKE
dialogues.text: Two people are dead — You. The girls —

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Bein’ the only witness to two murders.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (not having any of it) I’m calling the police. She lifts the wall phone. Mike quickly takes it from her hangs it back up.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Just trust me on this. Okay? A beat. Sarah, letting it all sink in. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Mike, I’m scared. He tilts his head down. Their foreheads touch.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Look at me... (she meets his eyes) Everything’s gonna be okay. Take the girls to your brother’s house. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t call anyone and don’t go anywhere ‘til you hear from me. Okay? She reluctantly nods, then goes. WE STAY WITH MIKE. He slides out a chair and collapses in into it. Exhausted. Confused. Trying to wrap his head aro everything. He just sits there, vacant, listening to the VOICES of his girls down the hall:

dialogues.speaker: CATELYN, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Can I play dress-up with Maggie?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: We'll see, sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: LILY, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: I wanna play dress-up, too.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Come on, girls. Uncle Drew's waiting. INT. POLICE DEPARTMENT, 2ND DISTRICT — SQUAD ROOM — NIGHT Quiet. Slow. Everyone in holiday wind down mode. INT. CAPTAIN DALEY’S OFFICE — NIGHT RED WINE is poured into a plastic Solo cup. DISTRICT CAPT DALEY, 60, portly, jolly, red-faced, sits behind his desk drinking the french wine as he tells a story to POLICE OFFICERS — RICH WHALEN, 40, brawny, mustached, and TERRY EDNEY, 30s, short, rat-faced, sitting across from him.

dialogues.speaker: DALEY
dialogues.text: — Prosecutor says to me, Can you describe what you saw when you entered the apartment? I says: Well, that gentlemen sitting there was having sex with two women. He says: Can you be more specific, please, Captain? So I say: Sure, Counselor. See that blonde there? He was hammering her from behind while the brunette over there was tickling his prostate. Whalen and Edney LAUGH. Daley’s cell phone VIBRATES atop desk. ‘Shawn calling...’ He answers:

dialogues.speaker: DALEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm partaking in some of your yuletide gift as we speak. INT. MAGUIRE HOME — STUDY — NIGHT ON SHAWN, sitting at his desk, on the phone. Not amused.

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: We have a problem. Daley motions with his hand for Whalen and Edney to leave They stand and go.

dialogues.speaker: DALEY
dialogues.text: (his mirth fading) Don’t tell me that...

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: It’s Colin. He’s got two bodies at his house.

dialogues.speaker: DALEY
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ. What the hell is wrong with that kid? Goddamnit, Shawn —

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: Shut your fat fuckin’ mouth. Do you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: DALEY
dialogues.text: Yeah. I’m sorry, Shawn.

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: There’s a witness. It’s Jimmy’s son.

dialogues.speaker: DALEY
dialogues.text: Conlon?

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: He’s on his way over there now to talk to him. Name is Michael Thomas Conlon. 2620 East Somerset. Daley scribbles the name and address down on a notepad.

dialogues.speaker: DALEY
dialogues.text: Whaddaya need from me?

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: Let me know if anything comes through dispatch. If it does, make sure your boys are there first.

dialogues.speaker: DALEY
dialogues.text: Alright. INT. DALEY’S OFFICE — SAME Daley hangs up, dispiritedly dumps the wine into the tras How quickly a good night can go to shit. He tears the she off the memo pad and calls out to the squadroom.

dialogues.speaker: DALEY
dialogues.text: Whalen, Edney. He waves the officers back in.  32. INT. MAGUIRE HOME — STUDY — NIGHT Shawn looks to Pat standing by the bookcases.

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: Make sure Colin stays put. We’ll wait to hear from Jimmy. Pat nods. A beat. Shawn appears lost in his thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: What are you thinking about?

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: The exact moment when the boy went wrong. EXT. MIKE’S ROW HOME — DRIVEWAY — NIGHT Mike and Sarah fasten Catelyn and Lily into the car seats inside her minivan. Mike KISSES Sarah, then watches the v reverse out of the drive. INT. MIKE’S ROW HOME — KITCHEN — NIGHT Mike removes a dusty bottle of whiskey from a cabinet, po himself a shot. Drinks it. Cringes, COUGHS, nearly PUKES the sink. He grabs the portable phone and sits at the kit table. DIALS 9-1... then stops... thinking... vacillating BOOM-BOOM-BOOM at the front door STARTLES HIM. A beat. BOOM-BOOM-BOOM. Mike stands, slips a butcher knife from a knife block. Mo charily across the LIVING ROOM to the door. Through the peephole he sees JIMMY standing there in his parka.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (sotto) Jesus Christ... He guardedly opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doin’ here?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Can I come in?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What for?  33.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I got a call from Shawn. You talk to the police yet?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Talk to the police about what?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Look, Michael, we both know why I’m here... Now let’s get this thing figured out so no one else gets hurt. Mike reluctantly lets Jimmy in. Closes the door, LOCKS it Jimmy sits in a chair, doesn’t bother taking his coat off thinking this will only take a few minutes. Mike takes a on the couch now. An awkward silence follows. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: So what, they sent you to keep me quiet?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Shawn uhh, well, he’d appreciate your support on this matter.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You mean he'd appreciate me keepin’ my mouth shut.

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: That’s right. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Who were they?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Not Mother Theresa I can tell ya that. Whatever Colin did, I’m sure he had a reason for it.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You always have a reason? Or were you just following marching orders?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Let’s just get through this night, huh? After that you can go back to hating me all you want. INT. COLIN’S CORVETTE — NIGHT ON A BLACKBERRY: vibrating on the dashboard. Caller ID re ‘Pat Calling...’ Colin answers.  34.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Yeah?... Alright... No, it’s all cleaned up... Didn’t I just fuckin’ say that!?... I get it, okay? I’m not goin’ nowhere... Colin hangs up. REVEAL NOW that the car is parked on MIKE'S STREET and Co is staring directly at Mike’s home. He reaches across KEN sitting in the passenger seat, takes a CLIP from the glov compartment and inserts in his 9MM — CLICK.

dialogues.speaker: KENAN
dialogues.text: Y’sure you wanna do this?

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: What, you got a pussy all’a sudden?

dialogues.speaker: KENAN
dialogues.text: No, it’s just — your dad told us not to go nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Fuck my dad. I’m not takin’ any chances on this one. Besides, I’1l be doin’ everyone a favor gettin’ ridda the old man anyway. Colin exits the car, Kenan follows. WE TRACK THE TWO as t stalk toward MIKE’S HOUSE... Kenan LIMPING with a bad leg down the ALLEY between homes, ducking under a window insi which WE SEE MIKE and JIMMY talking... to the BACKYARD wh Colin quietly lifts the CELLAR DOOR and they start down.. INT. MIKE’S ROW HOME — LIVING ROOM — NIGHT ON JIMMY: as he takes out his final cigarette and lights

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Don’t smoke in the house. Jimmy stubs it out, taps it back into the box for later. gazes around the room.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: The place looks good. I haven’t been here since —

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Mom's funeral. It was nice of you to show up.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Well I heard there was free booze.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: That’s funny to you?  35.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Lighten up, huh? I’m just tryin’ —

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Five years and it takes Shawn Maguire to get you to come see me.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: You never wanted me to come see you.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I won’t argue with you there. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So what happens now? I mean you’re the expert at this thing, right?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I‘1l go see Shawn. Let him know we talked. I’m sure he’1l wanna show his appreciation. A little money you could set aside for the girls.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Catelyn and Lily.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: What’s that?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: My daughters names. Catelyn Grace Conlon, and Lily Rose Conlon.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I know what their names are. Do they know mine?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: They don’t have a reason to. You’re not a part’a their lives. It’s bad enough you were a part’a mine... Lucky for mom and I you didn’t stick around too long. Jimmy absorbs the jab a moment, then stands.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I’1l go let Shawn know we talked. Goodbye, Michael. EXT. MIKE’S ROW HOME — NIGHT As Jimmy exits the home and moves into the street. He tak out that last cigarette again, is about to light it when NOTICES COLIN’S CORVETTE parked across the street.  36. INT. MIKE’S HOME — KITCHEN — NIGHT Mike gulps down a glass of water. Turns on the faucet and SPLASHES some water onto his face. INT. LIVING ROOM/HALL — SAME The BASEMENT DOOR OPENS EERILY SLOWLY. COLIN and KENAN st out, pistols in hand. They look around, SPOT Mike in the kitchen and start that way, walking soundlessly and —

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: shuts off the faucet and reaches for a towel. Dries his f then looks at his reflection in the window. He’s shocked the sight of COLIN, just feet behind him. He turns back — Colin RAISES the 9MM at him — Mike shuts his eyes, bracing for what’s next and —

dialogues.speaker: BLACK.
dialogues.text: For an uncomfortably long time. Finally: MIKE OPENS HIS EYES. Still alive. Colin has his hand on h neck, face twisted into a question mark, as if he’s been stung by a bee he never saw circling. Suddenly, a RIVER OF BLOOD seeps through Colin’s fingers runs down his shirt. He’s been shot in the neck. REVEAL JIMMY NOW... standing at the end of the hall... th $W1911 in hand... unlit cigarette dangling from his lips. Kenan looks down at his pistol... knowing he’1l be dead before he raises it. He makes the smart move and RUNS for back door... exits the home... Colin FALLS to his knees... then TOPPLES to the floor... dies... blood fanning out beneath him... Jimmy steps into the kitchen now. Stares down at a Colina moment. Slides out a chair and sits at the table.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Gimme a light, will ya. Mike opens a drawer, hands him a lighter. Jimmy lights th cigarette, exhales a long cloud of smoke. He reaches up f the portable phone and then just sits there for a few mom figuring out what he’ll say to his best friend. Finally, he dials the number...  37. INT. MAGUIRE HOME — MASTER BEDROOM — NIGHT Shawn’s on his knees, hands clasped together as he says h nightly prayers. A painting of the Virgin Mary is promine on the wall above him. In the background, ROSE sits at th vanity removing her make-up. The PHONE RINGS. Shawn reaches for it on the night stand.

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: Hello...

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Yeah it’s me. Shawn rises, sits on the edge of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: How'd it go with Michael? A beat.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I just killed your boy, Shawn... I just killed Colin. The blood leaves Shawn’s face. He forgets how to breathe for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He was gonna shoot Michael. Another beat.

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: And you’re sure he’s dead?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m sure. I’m looking at him right now. Shawn looks into the bathroom at Rose... his poor wife... only child... Rose turns back to him.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Who is it, honey? Shawn calmly shakes her off: it’s no one, not important.

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: (turns his body, quietly now so Rose won’t hear) You know how this has to end.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah I know...  38.

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: For Michael, too.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: (looking at Michael) Yeah... The longest beat now.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shawn...?

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: Mmm hmm.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Wherever we’re going when we cross that line, we’re going together, right? Shawn considers that a moment, then hangs up. INT. KITCHEN — NIGHT Jimmy listens to the DIAL TONE a moment... knowing everyt changes from this point forward... trying to process what all means for him... and for Michael. Finally, he sets the portable phone on the kitchen table. Mike quickly picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I’m calling the police.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: You don’t wanna do that.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I’m not asking for your advice. You don’t wanna be here, you’re free to walk out that door. Jimmy looks at Mike, then slowly gets to his feet and mak his way to the front door. At his back, he HEARS:

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Yes, this is Mike Conlon at 2620 East Somerset... A man’s been shot and killed here... No, my father did... Jimmy exits the home. INT. MAGUIRE HOME — MASTER BEDROOM — NIGHT Shawn moves into the bathroom and stands behind Rose and wraps his arms around her. He whispers in her ear, but we don’t hear what he says. Rose looks back at him.  39.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: No. Shawn... Shawn, no. No no no —

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry, Rose.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: (breaking) Not my boy, Shawn. Not my boy! No! No! Not my boy! No! She begins to BEAT HER FISTS against his chest. SOBBING. pulls her close and squeezes her so tight.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not my boy, Shawn...

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: Sshh... sshh... Off Shawn, holding her as she falls apart... INT. POLICE CRUISER, MOVING — PORT RICHMOND — NIGHT OFFICERS WHALEN and EDNEY slowly prowl the streets. The r CRACKLES to life:

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCHER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Report of a shooting at 2620 East Somerset. All units in area respond, over. The two cops share a look. Whalen reaches for the radio.

dialogues.speaker: WHALEN
dialogues.text: Copy that, dispatch. 157 responding. Eastbound on Cedar.
Edney hits the gas, switches on the SIRENS. INT. BUICK CENTURY — LATER

dialogues.speaker: ON THE CLOCK
dialogues.text: Jimmy observes Mike’s house from halfway down the block. POLICE CRUISER arrives out front, lights flashing. Whalen Edney step out, approach the home. INT. MIKE’S ROW HOME — NIGHT As Mike answers the door on Whalen and Edney.

dialogues.speaker: WHALEN
dialogues.text: Michael Conlon? (Mike NODS) Officers Whalen and Edney.  40.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Come on in. Whalen and Edney enter. Whalen peers into the kitchen, se Colin’s body. Pool of blood on the linoleum floor.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (vattled, searching) I don’t even know where to start with this whole thing. I uhh... I work as a limousine driver and earlier I picked up a reservation. Two gentlemen at the Rittenhouse Plaza —

dialogues.speaker: WHALEN
dialogues.text: Lift your arms for me, please. Mike lifts his arms. Edney PATS him down.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (continuing) They wanted me to take ‘em to the airport and —

dialogues.speaker: EDNEY
dialogues.text: Turn around.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Excuse me...? Whalen does it for him, SHOVING him up against the wall. Hard. Applying handcuffs now.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the hell’s goin’ on here? I was trying to explain to you... Whalen slips his Glock out and JAMS it into Mike’s cheek.

dialogues.speaker: WHALEN
dialogues.text: Feel that? Say another word and I‘11l blow your teeth out your ear. INT. BUICK CENTURY — NIGHT Jimmy watches as Whalen and Edney escort Mike out of the house and prod him into the back of the police cruiser.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ... He starts the engine. INT. POLICE CRUISER — NIGHT Edney at the wheel. Whalen lifts the radio:

dialogues.speaker: WHALEN
dialogues.text: 157 at 2620 East Somerset. That RA Unit en route?  41.

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCHER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: 10-4, 157. Northbound on Lehigh. An AMBULANCE SIREN can be heard in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: WHALEN
dialogues.text: Deceased white male in the kitchen here. Neighbor saw a suspect flee the house just before we arrived.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (stunned, realizing Whalen and Edney are in on it) Hey! HEY what the fuck is this?!

dialogues.speaker: WHALEN
dialogues.text: (looking at MIKE) White male, blue jeans, 6'1’.

dialogues.speaker: WHALEN
dialogues.text: (continuing) Suspect is armed. Officer Edney and I have secured the premises and’re gonna take a drive around to see if we can locate him. Mike KICKS the seats, SHOUTS —

EXT. STREET — NIGHT The Cruiser pulls away... followed closely by the Buick.. EXT. INTERSTATE 676/INT. POLICE CRUISER — NIGHT Mike in the backseat, fear deepening the farther and fart away from home they travel.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I’1ll pay you. I don’t make a lotta money, but I’1l empty my savings. There’s a retirement plan, too. I don’t know what’s in there, but... Whalen and Edney dismiss this with a LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please. I’m beggin’ yous. I got two little girls at home. Two little girls and my wife’s eight months pregnant.  42.

dialogues.speaker: WHALEN
dialogues.text: Sorry, kid. This one goes way over your head. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: EDNEY
dialogues.text: (turns back to Mike) So what’s it like havin’ Jimmy Conlon for a father?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (beat, then: ) I wouldn’t know. EXT. VINE STREET EXPRESSWAY — SAME As a CHRYSLER 300 cruises up the entrance ramp. INT. CHRYSLER 300, MOVING — SAME FRANK and BRENDAN inside. Frank’s on his cell:

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (re: the police cruiser) Yeah, Shawn, we got eyes on him now. We’re gonna make the exchange off’a 9th... No, it’s just the kid... INT. BUICK CENTURY, MOVING — SAME Jimmy’s just one car behind the Cruiser. An EXIT approach The Cruiser passes by. Jimmy ‘knows’ now what he already assumed: they’re not taking Mike to the precinct. He DRILLS the gas. The ancient engine GROWLS to life. PUL UP alongside the Cruiser and — INT. POLICE CRUISER — NIGHT Mike glances out the window, SEES JIMMY in the neighborin lane... and the BUICK COMING AT HIM FAST — SO FAST — and

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: The BUICK HITS THE CRUISER! The Cruiser SHUDDERS — its si SCRAPES UP against the median barrier — SPARKS FLY —

dialogues.speaker: EDNEY
dialogues.text: What the hell! Whalen and Edney LOOK OVER and SEE that it’s Jimmy. He’s coming at them again and —

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: More SHUDDERING! More SPARKS! Edney fights to straighten Cruiser.  43.

dialogues.speaker: WHALEN
dialogues.text: Motherfucker! Whalen LOWERS the window and FIRES his Glock — POP! POP! INT. BUICK CENTURY — SAME — POP! POP! — BULLETS SHATTER the driver's side window. G RAINS all over Jimmy who SLINGS OUT into the far lane. INT. CHRYSLER 300, MOVING — SAME FRANK and BRENDAN — watching the chaos unfold up ahead —

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (re: the Buick) Jesus Christ. It’s Jimmy. EXT. VINE STREET EXPRESSWAY — WIDE — CONTINUOUS As the Police Cruiser and the Buick FLY DOWN the intersta SWERVING IN AND OUT of traffic — SLAMMING into one anothe some insane death dance. INT. BUICK CENTURY, MOVING — SAME Jimmy AIMS his .45 out his window and FIRES — POP! POP! P INT. POLICE CRUISER — SAME EDNEY DUCKS, then looks out the windshield only to find h about to SMASH INTO THE BACK OF FREIGHT TRUCK — He SWERVES at the last possible moment — VEERS ACROSS THR HIGHWAY LANES — CRASHES INTO THE MEDIAN BARRIER — BOOSH! CONCRETE EXPLOSION and —

dialogues.speaker: ON MIKE
dialogues.text: SLOW-MOTION NOW as the CRUISER GOES AIRBORNE — FLIPPING O — the cars, the city lights, the night sky — all of it UP DOWN. REAL TIME RESUMES AS — THOOMP!— it LANDS ON ITS ROO EXT. VINE STREET EXPRESSWAY — NIGHT and SKIDS ACROSS EASTBOUND TRAFFIC before finally coming rest against the barrier wall. All TRAFFIC HALTS. DRIVERS climb out of the cars to gape the horrible wreckage.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: bursts out of the Buick, .45 in hand as he hops over the median. A TRIO OF GOOD SAMARITANS near the cruiser to loo for survivors. Jimmy FIRES the pistol into the air:

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Get back! I said get the fuck back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samaritans spook and RETREAT. Jimmy arrives at the Police Cruiser. Peers inside. EDNEY dead, head slumped limply, unnaturally to one side. WHALE appears to be unconscious. In the backseat, MIKE is dazed scrapes and bruises on his face. Jimmy tries to YANK OPEN the crinkled backseat door. Too JAMMED. So he SMASHES the butt of the pistol against the window — CRACK! — SHATTERING IT. He SHOUTS inside now:

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mike! (nothing, LOUDER now) Michael, goddmanit get up! Mike SNAPS from his stupor, localizes the noise. SEES Jim leaning inside the window. It’s like he’s awakening from worst nightmare of his life...only it’s not a nightmare. He glances down at the HANDCUFFS. Then sees the CARBON FI handcuff key on NANCE’S GUN BELT. Grabs it along with NAN PISTOL and begins to removes the handcuffs as — INT. CHRYSLER 300 — FRANK AND BRENDAN stopped a quarter-mile back from the accident. They LEAP of the Chrysler, pistols in hand and weave their way thro traffic towards the scene accident. INT. POLICE CRUISER — SAME Mike SLIPS OFF the handcuffs. Jimmy reaches in.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Gimme your hand! Mike stares at his father’s hand... the last person on Ea he wants any help from. But what choice does he have? Mike GRABS it. Jimmy PULLS HIM out through the window. Th two START TO RUN DOWN the expressway shoulder. Manage to ten strides away when — GUNFIRE FILLS THE NIGHT. JIMMY’S HIT in the shoulder and FALLS to the ground. Mike SPINS back to find — WHALEN staggering towards them. He’s managed to climb out the cruiser. Weakly RAISES THE PISTOL AT MIKE and — Mike — instinct taking over — FIRES FIRST — HITTING WHALE the gut. Whalen clutches his stomach and FALLS... dead... A long beat.  45. Mike looks around... everyone staring at him in shock... weight of what he’s just done sinking in... a killer now. From the ground, Jimmy SEES FRANK AND BRENDAN approaching labors to his feet and YANKS Mike away —

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We gotta move. (Mike’s frozen) Now goddamnit! They RUN. In the distance, Jimmy FOCUSES ON the large whi pillars of 30th STREET TRAIN STATION... INT. 30TH STREET STATION — LOBBY — NIGHT Packed with travelers scuttling across the concourse. Jimmy and Mike burst in. Mike starts like he’s about to t off, but Jimmy reins him in.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Wait... Mike follows his eyes to the COPS PROWLING the lobby and DETECTION K-9s making the rounds. They adopt a casual gait, blending in and slowly make the way across the lobby floor.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK AND BRENDAN
dialogues.text: enter the station now and look around. Nothing. They spread out.

dialogues.speaker: CONCOURSE
dialogues.text: Jimmy and Mike moving through a CRUSH OF PEDESTRIANS, fee the urgency and picking up the pace.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: stalks through that same concourse. SEES JIMMY UP AHEAD stepping onto a DOWN ESCALATOR. He RUNS now, KNOCKING peo out of the way — holiday shopping bags hitting the floor he PUSHES HIS WAY ONTO THE ESCALATOR and —

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: turns back, SEES Frank nearing.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Shit! Jimmy sights him now, too. Mike TAKES OFF. Jimmy’s not quick enough. Frank GRABS a fistful of Jimmy’s parka. A STRUGGLE ENSUES.  46.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: steps off the escalator and turns back. SEES Jimmy in a struggle, being pummeled by Frank. He decides to leave him.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: deflecting blows — manages to FLEE FRANK'S GRASP. He STUM off the escalator and RUNS INTO the —

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM
dialogues.text: tries to lock the door when — BA-WOOMP! the DOOR FLIES BACKWARD as FRANK comes barrelin in, KNOCKING Jimmy to the floor. Frank locks the door and stares down at Jimmy, a shit-eating grin curling on his f

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I’ve been waitin’ a long time for this, Conlon. Frank KICKS Jimmy in the ribs. Jimmy MOANS, tries to CRAW AWAY. Frank DRAGS grabs his leg and PULLS him back, KICKI him over and over. Jimmy WRITHES in pain.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m enjoying this even more than I thought.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Yunno your wife called me last night. Another KICK to Jimmy’s ribs. Jimmy GRIMACES.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (teeth-clenched in pain) Goddamnit... you fuckin’...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What'd my wife say?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: (catches his breath, then) She wanted to take me up on my offer.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: And I gotta tell ya, Frank. I’ve never seen a woman swallow twelve inches like she did. Frank SMILES, almost appreciates the moxie of the tough o prick. He PICKS JIMMY UP by his brown parka and delivers PALE-HORSE PUNCH to Jimmy’s face. Jimmy WHEELS BACKWARDS the trash can, collapses to the floor. Tired, bloodied, d  47. Frank REMOVES an HK P30 PISTOL from the waist of his jean and starts towards Jimmy as — Jimmy inconspicuously SLIPS the belt off his trousers and Frank raises the pistol and — WHAP! Jimmy WHIPS HIM ACROSS THE FACE with the belt buckl Frank DROPS the pistol, doubles over, holding his eye.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Fuck — you MOTHERFUCKER — ! Jimmy’s on his feet — WRAPS the belt around Frank’s neck a garrotte — PULLING IT SO FUCKING TIGHT and — Frank FIGHTS HIM LIKE A BULL — wheeling backwards — then forward — SLAMMING JIMMY INTO THE STALLS and AGAINST THE — HIS FACE AN INFERNO and — Jimmy’s knuckles whiten — teeth clench tighter — mining e ounce of strength left in his wearied bones... Until... finally... Frank’s strength wanes... resistance flags... he COLLAPSES over the sinks, and DIES... Jimmy lets him down. Takes a moment to find his breath. S on the verge of collapse and has to steady himself agains the wall... INT. SUBWAY PLATFORM — MINUTES LATER As Jimmy joins the crowd of others waiting for the subway Keeps his head down, avoids eye contact. A LIGHT appears in the tunnel. The SUBWAY nears. Jimmy looks back at the stairwell. BRENDAN enters the platform and surveys the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: moving through the throng. SEES Jimmy’s brown parka up ah SLIPS a pistol out.

dialogues.speaker: THE SUBWAY
dialogues.text: Brakes HISS as it arrives at the platform.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: grabs the brown parka and SPINS the man around. JABS the pistol into his gun and...

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Say goodbye, motherfucker — ..-But it’s not Jimmy. Just a grizzled old BUM, happy as clam about his new winter coat.  48.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: head low, slips onto the SUBWAY CAR. The DOORS CLOSE. He watches Brendan frantically looking around as the train leaves the station and disappears into a tunnel. He EXHALES, falls into a seat... EXT. INTERSTATE 676, VINE STREET EXPRESSWAY — NIGHT The scene of the accident. A circus. Flares, police tape, traffic backed up for miles. HORNS from impatient drivers For HARDING it’s just another night on the job as he crou down beside the cruiser. Gets a look at Edney inside, the turns to Whalen’s lifeless body ten yards down the road. FLORES appears behind him.

dialogues.speaker: FLORES
dialogues.text: You ready for this?

dialogues.speaker: HARDING
dialogues.text: Do me a favor and get ridda that.

dialogues.speaker: FLORES
dialogues.text: Ridda what?

dialogues.speaker: HARDING
dialogues.text: ‘You ready for this?’ First thing you’re gonna learn is you’re not ready for any of it, but it’s comin’ anyway.

dialogues.speaker: FLORES
dialogues.text: (nodding, a bit embarrassed) Right.

dialogues.speaker: HARDING
dialogues.text: Go ‘head.

dialogues.speaker: FLORES
dialogues.text: The Buick over there, one that ran the cruiser into the median?

dialogues.speaker: HARDING
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: FLORES
dialogues.text: Registered to a James Edward Conlon. Harding turns back to Flores. Now he’s listening. FLORES (CONT’D) Just got off with the dispatcher. Last contact she had with the patrol car was at 2620 Somerset Street. Officers responded to a report of a shooting. Wanna guess who the homeowner is?  49.

dialogues.speaker: HARDING
dialogues.text: Frosty the Snowman?

dialogues.speaker: FLORES
dialogues.text: Michael Conlon.

dialogues.speaker: HARDING
dialogues.text: (nonplussed) Conlon’s got a son?

dialogues.speaker: FLORES
dialogues.text: (nods) He called it in. Said his father just shot and killed someone. The body they found inside was Colin Maguire. Harding, never surprised by what he hears anymore, takes moment with this one. He turns back to the cruiser, SEES something inside and REACHES for it. He lifts the VACANT HANDCUFFS into frame... thinking... MOMENTS LATER — HARDING AND FLORES heading back to their car when DETECTIVES SAYERS and NANC (the two plainclothes detectives we met inside Colin’s office) arrive and step from an unmarked Crown Victoria.

dialogues.speaker: SAYERS
dialogues.text: Looks like we’ve got ourselves a blue- ribbon shitshow here, huh, Harding.

dialogues.speaker: HARDING
dialogues.text: If we didn’t, we do now. What’re you two doin’ here?

dialogues.speaker: NANCE
dialogues.text: Chief wants all hands on deck for this one.

dialogues.speaker: SAYERS
dialogues.text: (patronizing) You might finally catch your white whale.

dialogues.speaker: HARDING
dialogues.text: Not if you have anything to do with it, Sayers. Do me a favor and stay the hell outta my way. Flores, behind the curve, trying to understand the histor

dialogues.speaker: SAYERS
dialogues.text: Gladly.

dialogues.speaker: NANCE
dialogues.text: (shit-eating grin) See you boys around. Harding and Flores climb into a Dodge Charger and drive o  50. INT. SUBWAY CAR, MOVING — NIGHT A SMALL PUDDLE OF BLOOD. Drips from Jimmy’s sweatshirt onto the floor. The sleeve soaked from the bullet wound. PAN UP to Jimmy. Pallid and weak. Across the aisle, a BLA WOMAN stares warily at him.
